response.answer_text: Not as autonomous mechanisms, just a remotely controlled systems. The military uses them for IED disarming by placing explosive charges on the IED. Alternatively, they can be outfitted with firearms that can be used to shoot the IED. We also have flying killer robots. They operate by remote control and are armed with lethal weapons. So far, we do not let the robots decide when to use their weapons. There is always a human in the decision loop.
